intro: Guioa diplopetala f. microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited guioa, is a flowering plant species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by smooth, spherical fruits that mature to a dark brown color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in lowland forests and secondary growth areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated for landscaping and reforestation purposes.
